channel.title: Windows Re-Installing Problems
channel.description:
Hey,
I was re-installing my windows from directions from [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,31099.0.html]here[/url] and I downloaded, and burned the ISO onto a blank disc. But there is one problem, no matter how many times that I change the boot settings in my BIOS, it ALWAYS boots to my hard drive. I have tried both of my CD drives, so I know it's not that. I don't know why it's doing it now though. I have re-installed my windows many times before, and then haven't for about 8 months. The only thing that I might think would be my problem is the fact that I installed the stupid boot screen because I got sick of seeing the Windows XP logo everytime I turned my computer on. But, like I said, I'm not sure if it is this. I already checked to see if the ISO was bootable (Magic ISO) and it is. Has anyone ever had this problem, and if they had, or haven't, do they know how to fix it.
[center]Thanks for reading,
Buzzy [/center]

item.title: Windows Re-Installing Problems
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

The problem is fixed now, even when I changed the BIOS settings it still wouldn’t boot from the CD.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Re-Installing Problems
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

While booting up try pressing f12, see if you can boot from disk, usb ect.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Re-Installing Problems
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

I did, and I think I found the problem. I haven’t re-installed Windows XP Pro in about 8 months now, and last time I did it, it was from a neighbors CD. I’m burning the CD right now, so I don’t know if it works, but I extracted the ISO this time using WINRAR. So, I’ll post my results and tell you if that worked.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Re-Installing Problems
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Hmm… that is a strange problem. The new bootscreen should have nothing to do with it, unless you changed the bootscreen of the BIOS (in that case, it might be a BIOS flashing screw-up), but I doubt that that is the problem.

I have a feeling you didn’t set the boot order up correctly And make sure you choose ‘Save & Exit’ whenever you exit the BIOS settings

Read full topic
